result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David J Gioielli was found guilty of OWI (4th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
SECOND AMENDED 09-25-2014:  Probation may be transferred to Walworth County.

miscConds.notes: Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Mukwonago Police Department.  Cash bail applied - PAID IN FULL.  DNA surcharge ($250) to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
120 days of Day Report Center, consecutive to Condition Time.  Day Report Center has the authorization to use SCRAM if deemed appropriate.

Cash bail applied.  Balance of fine to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions.
TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

AMENDED 07-31-2014:  Defendant may serve condition time at the Walworth County Detention Center - upon their approval.  NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David J Gioielli in court with attorney Jamie J LaVora.  Debra Lynn Blasius appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law. 
  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days)
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  6 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

*D/L REVOCATION: 48 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 48 months.

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
*Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
*120 days of Day Report Center, consecutive to condition time.  DRC has authorization to use SCRAM if deemed appropriate.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 (apply bail - to be forward to Town of Mukwonago Police Department);

FINE:  $2277 (apply bail, balance to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  120 DAYS - NON WORKING HOURS w/Standard Release Conditions. To commence forthwith. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 24, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
